      • Cell

        public Cell(int VertexPattern)
        Construct a unit Cell (1x1x1 dimensions at 0,0,0 coordinates) with a specified vertex pattern
        Parameters:

      • Cell

        public Cell(float x,
            float y,
            float z,
            float XBounds,
            float YBounds,
            float ZBounds)
        Constructs a new root level cell
        Parameters:
        x - Cell location in x dimension
        y - Cell location in y dimension
        z - Cell location in z dimension
        xBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in x dimension
        yBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in y dimension
        zBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in z dimension

      • Cell

        public Cell(float x,
            float y,
            float z,
            float XBounds,
            float YBounds,
            float ZBounds,
            int vertexPattern)
        Constructs a new root level cell with a specific vertex pattern
        Parameters:
        x - Cell location in x dimension
        y - Cell location in y dimension
        z - Cell location in z dimension
        xBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in x dimension
        yBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in y dimension
        zBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in z dimension
        vertexPattern - integer which predetermines which vertices are flagged as inside of outside the surface using bit positions for the 8 vertices

      • Cell

        public Cell(float x,
            float y,
            float z,
            int level,
            float xBounds,
            float yBounds,
            float zBounds,
            Patch parent)
        Constructs a new cell
        Parameters:
        x - Cell position in x dimension
        y - Cell position in y dimension
        z - Cell position in z dimension
        level - the distance from the object root
        xBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in x dimension
        yBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in y dimension
        zBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in z dimension
        parent - a reference to the Cell's immediate parent
        index - a 3 dimensional identifier for the cell. Unique for each level, but not for entire object

      • Cell

        public Cell(float x,
            float y,
            float z,
            int level,
            float xBounds,
            float yBounds,
            float zBounds,
            Patch parent,
            int vertexPattern)
        Constructs a new cell
        Parameters:
        x - Cell position in x dimension
        y - Cell position in y dimension
        z - Cell position in z dimension
        level - the distance from the object root
        xBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in x dimension
        yBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in y dimension
        zBounds - The distance of the cell boundary from the position point in z dimension
        parent - a reference to the Cell's immediate parent
        index - a 3 dimensional identifier for the cell. Unique for each level, but not for entire object
        vertexPattern - Integer bit pattern specified which vertices are flagged as inside of outside the surface. Bit positions correspond with vertex numbers as specified in the report

      • getVertexIdentifier

        public int getVertexIdentifier()
        First stage of the marching cubes algorithm is to identify which of the 8 corner vertices exist inside the surface and which are outside.
        Returns:
        byte An 8 bit representation of the vertices inside the surface with each bit position representing a single vertex

      • vertexGroupCount

        public int vertexGroupCount()
        Get the number of vertex groups. This indicates the number of disconnected meshes that will be required to draw the cell geometry
        Returns:
